Results and Discussion

Demonstration: Robotic Writing in Real Time

This video showcases the complete flow from live speech to robotic handwriting. As the user speaks, the system transcribes the speech and immediately sends stroke instructions to the Dobot Magician arm, which writes the output in real time.

Demo 1: Dobot Magician performing live handwriting based on spoken input

Demonstration: Live Speech-to-Text Conversion

This screen recording captures the live speech-to-text transcription process, powered by an offline model (Vosk). The system continuously processes microphone input, providing real-time text results for downstream robotic execution.

Demo 2: Real-time transcription of voice input using DNN-HMM and Vosk

System Highlights

  • Instant Feedback: Minimal latency between speech and robot writing
  • Offline Capability: No internet required for speech recognition or control
  • Smooth Handwriting: Predefined vector paths ensure clean, consistent strokes
  • Hardware-Software Sync: Live robot motion even during ongoing speech input

Known Limitations

  • Background Noise: Accuracy may drop in noisy environments without a directional mic
  • Flat Surface Required: Paper must be placed precisely in the robot's workspace
